video.title: How to Build an MVP for Your App – Full Course on Minimum Viable Product Development
video.description:
Learn how to build a Minimum Viable Product (MVP). An MVP is a version of a product with just enough features to be usable by early customers who can then provide feedback for future product development. You will learn how to build an MVP using the Retool platform.

✏️ Ania Kubow developed this course. Check out her channel: https://www.youtube.com/aniakubow

🏗 Retool provided a grant to make this course possible. Learn more about Retool: https://retool.com

⭐️ Course Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (00:00) What is an MVP?
⌨️ (02:10) Why is an MVP useful?
⌨️ (04:42) Getting started with Retool
⌨️ (06:25) Adding components
⌨️ (14:15) Adding MongoDB database
⌨️ (19:05) Inserting data
⌨️ (23:05) Populating feed with data
⌨️ (27:25) Updating CSS
⌨️ (31:21) Adding a trigger
⌨️ (38:16) Create timeline of posts
⌨️ (43:21) Add messages feature
⌨️ (1:03:20) Add upload feature
⌨️ (1:08:28) Configure Amazon S3
⌨️ (1:12:14) Create uploader
⌨️ (1:13:49) Conclusion

🎉 Thanks to our Champion and Sponsor supporters:
👾 Raymond Odero
👾 Agustín Kussrow
👾 aldo ferretti
👾 Otis Morgan
👾 DeezMaster

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://freecodecamp.org/news

topLevelComment.author: Technical Boy
topLevelComment.text: This is not coding. Change your channels name. not interested in mind numbing no code/low code.

replies.text: @William This. The amount of people getting on the Jabaskript-Webh-Debh-get rich-quick bandwagon needs to go down.

replies.author: Bob niks
replies.text: @Technical Boy Wow you really gatekeeping huh? Not everyone who does programming loves it. Some do it because of the money and that is perfectly fine. No one said that you had to watch all the videos on this channel. If you don't see the benefit in watching this video, just go watch something else. Also, feel free to create whatever is made in this video without the provided software. In the meantime, your competitor already finished several products.

replies.author: Technical Boy
replies.text: @Viktor Ferenczi I suggest you get into something else, other than coding. You don't really love it, just pretending to yourself.  People are becoming super dumb and lazy thanks to AI etc. It's the same as asking the question "why paint when you can get a computer to do it".  "Why make your own chair from scratch when you can just buy from IKEA'. If you don't know the answer then you don't have passion.

replies.author: Viktor Ferenczi
replies.text: Why to reinvent the wheel all the time, especially to build an MVP? I would suggest concentrating your precious coding time on solving the real business problems.
